instructions:
Sift flour, measure, add salt and sift again. Combine slightly beaten yolk and water, then stir into flour
mixture. If too dry to handle, gradually add a few drops of water at a time, no more than necessary. Turn out
on lightly floured board and kneed about 5 minutes or until smooth. Cover lightly and let stand 20 to 30
minutes.
Divide dough in 3 parts and roll out each part until paper-thin. Roll dough jelly-roll fashion or fold into
several layers and slice evenly into narrow strips. Separate and straighten the strips on waxed paper and let
dry for 4 hours before cooking. *(Dry for an additional 2 hours before storing in cool dry place.)*
To cook, drop into rapidly boiling salted water and boil 10 to 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and serve.
Makes about the equivalent of an 8 ounce package.
name: Egg Noodles
